programme.title: Been There All Along
programme.desc: After her public breakup, Charley, the people-pleasing but determined founder of a dating app, is near bankruptcy and must team up with Liam, a self-assured and innovative marketing expert, to save her company. The answer to their problems may have been there all along.

programme.title: A Royal Makeover
programme.desc: When all-American Ramone discovers he is the heir to the European kingdom of San Pablo, he is daunted by the prospect of becoming king. To prepare him for his royal duties, King Felipe hires royal expert Angelica to show Ramone the ropes.

programme.title: Romantic Friction
programme.desc: Book-cover artist Lea pretends to be the elusive author of a hit romance novel that was secretly written by snobbish literary novelist Michael. She doesn't expect to find love herself.

programme.title: The Chateau Meroux
programme.desc: Wendy inherits the beautiful and cash-strapped Napa Valley Winery and has to compete against a ruthless neighbor to keep her new business from failing.

programme.title: Little John
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. A father reunites his daughter and the child she gave up for adoption.

programme.title: The Beach House
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. Cara returns to the scenic Lowcountry to visit her mother.

programme.title: In My Dreams
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. Natalie and Nick wish into a fountain, then start dreaming about the other.

programme.title: Cupid & Cate
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. A young woman breaks off an uninspired relationship when she falls for another.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Following a traumatic experience, former Special Forces member Dean Cage (Wesley Snipes) is trying to pick up the pieces of his fractured life. With the help of detective Amy Knight (Jacqueline Obradors), Dean tries to block out the painful wartime memories, including the death of his best friend. Everything goes awry, however, when Dean is mistaken for a rogue CIA agent. He is abducted and given a truth serum, and now he must find an antidote to the debilitating psychotropic drug.

programme.title: A Birder's Guide to Everything
programme.desc: On the eve of his father's remarriage, a teenage birding enthusiast (Kodi Smit-McPhee) leads his friends on a road trip to find an extremely rare duck.

programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: Follows Captain Alexei Vostrikov who, at the height of the Cold War, is ordered to take over command of the nuclear missile submarine K-19, pride of the Soviet Navy. His assignment: Prepare the K-19 for sea and take her out on patrol -- no matter what the cost. But problems with the K-19 arise that may lead to a core meltdown and explosion that will certainly kill all aboard, and possibly trigger a nuclear war. Vostrikov must choose between his orders and the lives of his men.

programme.title: Miracle
programme.desc: When college coach Herb Brooks (Kurt Russell) is hired to helm the 1980 U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, he brings a unique and brash style to the ice. After assembling a team of hot-headed college all-stars, who are humiliated in an early match, Brooks unites his squad against a common foe, the heavily-favored Soviet team. As the U.S. squad tries to overcome insurmountable odds and win the gold medal, the team becomes a microcosm for American patriotism during the Cold War.

programme.title: The Proposition
programme.desc: In the 1880s Australia, a lawman offers renegade Charlie Burns a difficult choice. In order to save his younger brother from the gallows, Charlie must hunt down and kill his older brother, who is wanted for rape and murder. Venturing into one of the Outback's most inhospitable regions, Charlie faces a terrible moral dilemma that can end only in violence.

programme.title: A Little Bit of Heaven
programme.desc: New Orleans ad executive Marley Corbett (Kate Hudson) is a free-spirited woman who embraces her easy sexuality, shuns commitment, and gains support and strength from a close circle of friends. Then Marley learns she has terminal colon cancer. Despite her determination not to be tied down in a serious relationship, Marley finds herself falling in love with her handsome doctor (Gael Garca Bernal), even as her health slowly deteriorates.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Following a traumatic experience, former Special Forces member Dean Cage (Wesley Snipes) is trying to pick up the pieces of his fractured life. With the help of detective Amy Knight (Jacqueline Obradors), Dean tries to block out the painful wartime memories, including the death of his best friend. Everything goes awry, however, when Dean is mistaken for a rogue CIA agent. He is abducted and given a truth serum, and now he must find an antidote to the debilitating psychotropic drug.

programme.title: A Birder's Guide to Everything
programme.desc: On the eve of his father's remarriage, a teenage birding enthusiast (Kodi Smit-McPhee) leads his friends on a road trip to find an extremely rare duck.

programme.title: The Jesus Rolls
programme.desc: Hours after his release from prison, Jesus Quintana pairs up with fellow misfits Petey and Marie for a freewheeling joyride of petty crime and romance.

programme.title: Ike Boys
programme.desc: When a magical anime transforms two Japan-obsessed teenage friends and a shy foreign exchange student into its superpowered characters, the three underdogs must discover their inner heroes in time to save the world.

programme.title: Trespass
programme.desc: Fast-talking diamond dealer Kyle Miller (Nicolas Cage) and his wife, Sarah (Nicole Kidman), live the good life in a beautiful home surrounded by thick woods. Their dream life turns into a nightmare when violent thieves, led by Elias (Ben Mendelsohn), invade their home disguised as police officers. With Kyle and Sarah now frightened captives, Kyle knows he must use every negotiating trick in his book, for once Elias and his men get what they want, the Millers will likely be killed.

programme.desc: In 1999, Officer Dave Brown (Woody Harrelson), a 24-year veteran of the Los Angeles Police Department, tends to follow his own code of rough justice. A number of years earlier, he was implicated in the death of a serial rapist. Brown's violent tendencies once again land him in hot water when a video of him beating up a suspect plays all over local TV. An assistant DA (Sigourney Weaver) pressures him to retire, but Brown edges closer and closer to a meltdown.

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
programme.desc: Unfulfilled and facing financial ruin, actor Nick Cage accepts a $1 million offer to attend a wealthy fan's birthday party. Things take a wildly unexpected turn when a CIA operative recruits Cage for an unusual mission. Taking on the role of a lifetime, he soon finds himself channeling his most iconic and beloved characters to save himself and his loved ones.

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: Having long-since abandoned his life as a lethal soldier, John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) lives a solitary life near the Thai border. Two weeks after guiding a missionary (Julie Benz) and her comrades into Burma, he gets an urgent call for help. The missionaries have not returned and although he is reluctant to embrace violence again, Rambo sets out to rescue the captives from the Burmese army.

programme.title: Rambo: Last Blood
programme.desc: Vietnam War veteran John Rambo tries to find some semblance of peace by raising horses on a ranch in Arizona. He's also developed a special familial bond with a woman named Maria and her teenage granddaughter Gabriela. But when a vicious Mexican cartel kidnaps Gabriela, Rambo crosses the border on a bloody and personal quest to rescue her and punish those responsible.

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: Involuntarily discharged from the Army, a special forces sergeant lands a contract with a private underground military force. When his very first assignment goes awry, the elite soldier finds himself hunted and on the run, caught in a dangerous conspiracy and fighting to stay alive long enough to get home and uncover the true motives of those who betrayed him.

programme.title: The Foreigner
programme.desc: Quan is a humble London businessman whose long-buried past erupts in a revenge-fueled vendetta when the only person left for him to love -- his teenage daughter -- dies in a senseless act of politically motivated terrorism. His relentless search to find the terrorists leads to a cat-and-mouse conflict with a British government official whose own past may hold the clues to the identities of the elusive killers.

programme.title: Alex Rider: Operation Stormbreaker
programme.desc: After his uncle dies, a young boy learns of his relative's true occupation as an undercover spy and is later recruited to be undercover himself. Based on the novel by Anthony Horowitz.

programme.desc: When evil Archibald Snatcher decides to capture the Boxtrolls lovable, box-wearing creatures it's up to Eggs and his friend Winnie to same them.

programme.desc: A turf battle between New York City street gangs that rages from Coney Island to the Bronx. The Warriors are mistakenly fingered for the killing of a gang leader. Soon they have every gang in the city out to get revenge, and they must make their way across the city to their own turf.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: Scientist Karen Ross (Laura Linney) is sent by her father-in-law, mogul R.B. Travis (Joe Don Baker), to the Congo to determine the whereabouts of his son's missing diamond-hunting team. Led by expert guide Kelly (Ernie Hudson), Ross and a mismatched search party -- including primatologist Dr. Peter Elliot (Dylan Walsh), treasure hunter Herkermer Homolka (Tim Curry) and a gorilla -- discover a danger far more sinister than anything they expected to find, even in the heart of the jungle.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: Reserved college dean Susan Middlecott (Rosalind Russell) is all business and can't be bothered with love. However, when Susan meets charming British astronomy professor Alec Stevenson (Ray Milland), it seems that romance could be in the air. Though she resists being paired with Alec, things don't go as planned -- particularly when a publicity agent and even Susan's amiable father (Edmund Gwenn) get involved. Soon Susan may just be in love, whether she likes it or not.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Princess Salome (Rita Hayworth) is the daughter of King Herod (Charles Laughton) of Galilee. Cast out after her affair with Caesar's nephew, Salome finds herself back in the kingdom of her father when she falls in love with Claudius (Stewart Granger), the commander of her father's army. Meanwhile, Salome's evil mother, Queen Herodias, is continually being condemned by John the Baptist, and plotting to use Salome as a tool to get the prophet executed.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: Veteran secret agent Matt Helm (Dean Martin) is living a life of luxury when his former lover, Tina Batori (Daliah Lavi), pulls him back into action. A sinister group known as the Big O has developed a plot to start a global nuclear conflict, so the carefree, womanizing Helm must stop the scheme of mastermind Tung-Tze (Victor Buono). Joining the suave Helm on his mission is the beautiful but inept operative Gail Hendricks (Stella Stevens), along with other gorgeous ladies.

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins

programme.desc: Will Ferrell & Mark Wahlberg face off in this Dad vs Step-Dad showdown! Brad (Ferrell) wants to be the best step-dad to his new wife's kids. But when their actual father Dusty (Wahlberg) shows up, the two must go toe-to-toe in this fun family comedy.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.2
programme.desc: Leaving the collapsed Gwanghae behind, Jeongi escapes home with Taedo's help. While hiding at a tavern, Jeongi overhears a conversation between King Seonjo and Euldam, only to be startled when her eyes meet Gwanghae's. King Seonjo orders Euldam to create ritual vessels to be used for the Jongmyo ancestral rites.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.3
programme.desc: Tormented by the shattered fragments of the sacred jar of King Taejo, Gwanghae seeks out Son Haengsu. Recognizing him, Hwa-ryeong urges Gwanghae to meet Jeongi, and he is stunned to learn that she is Euldam's daughter. When Jeongi falls from her horse and lands in Gwanghae's arms, she panics and struggles in surpriseonly for them both to tumble to the ground.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.4
programme.desc: Determined to prove that the sacred jar of King Taejo was deliberately broken, Gangcheon drops the vessel onto the floor. As King Seonjo erupts in fury, Gwanghae steps forward and claims full responsibility for the act. King Seonjo immediately orders Euldam's arrest. In a desperate attempt to save her father, Jeongi strikes the petition drum, proclaiming Euldam's innocence to the court

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.5
programme.desc: Jeongi clings to Euldam, sobbing and begging him not to go, while the wounded Taedo fumes in frustration after seeing an assassin vanish into the darkness. Seeking out Hwa-ryeong, Jeongi travels to the merchant guild, where she comes face to face with Gangcheon. She boldly asks whether he will apologize for humiliating Euldam once she becomes the greatest master potter in Joseon.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.6
programme.desc: Jeongi accuses Gwanghae of stealing her jade belt, and as she tries to flee and leave him behind, she is seized once again by Gwanghae. Forced to wander with their wrists bound together, the two soon find themselves in grave danger. As punishment for losing the royal jade belt, Gwanghae is assigned as deputy director under the chief artisan Shinseong. Meanwhile, Jeongi sets out on a journey to enter the Bunwon pottery workshop

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.7
programme.desc: Reunited at last, Jeongi and Taedo recognize each other and share all that has happened. Taedo reluctantly lets Jeongi go as she sets her sights on the Bunwon workshop. Entering the Gongchogun selection exam, Jeongi is arrested and thrown into jail after being accused of attempting to cut down palace trees while searching for firewood. Desperate, she pleads with Gwanghae for help, insisting that she must become a master potter no matter what.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.8
programme.desc: Mistaking it for Gwanghae's test, Jeongi sneaks into the Bunwon storeroom to choose pottery, only to be caught red-handed by Gangcheon. While confined, she finally realizes that the man she believed to be Gwanghae was actually someone else. As Jeongi tearfully confesses all the wrongs she has committed against him, Gwanghae listens with a quiet smile.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In Part One, Steve experienced the difficulty of hunting the Sooty grouse of southeast Alaska.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Wild to Table: Memorable Meals Cooking Special
programme.desc: Steve loves to fish as much as he loves to hunt.Steve is on a river in SW Montana for a day to catch.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Up at the Cabin: Prince of Wales Island Black Bear
programme.desc: Last spring, Steve decided to pass up an opportunity to kill a black bear in favor of an extended up close and personal experience. This time, Steve heads back to his shack on Prince of Wales Island and he's brought his friend Paul Neess from Vortex Optics along to share the experience of using a canoe to slip in close to these giant black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: All across America hunters kick off the fall hunting season with a weekend of doves, friends, and food. Steve's lifelong friend, Ronny Boehme has invited Steve out to his digs in Virginia for the dove opener. To prep for opening day, Steve and Ron spend a day brushing up on their shooting skills on a sporting clays course followed by a pigeon hunt. Steve shares simple, delicious cooking methods for doves and pigeons.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Ryan Callaghan and Aaron Evans join Steve on an epic adventure in British Columbia's Rockies to pursue grizzly bears. Steve has long desired to take a grizzly but only if he can do it in a way that fits his personal ethics. The hunt is dampened by frustrating weather but Steve finds a way to fix a tasty meal.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Lobster of the Prairie: Wyoming Antelope
programme.desc: Steve is fed up with disrespect for one of the world's most unique game animals-the pronghorn antelope.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Land of the Giants: Idaho Mule Deer Part 1
programme.desc: Steve's quest for a giant mule deer buck continues in central Idaho.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Land of the Giants: Idaho Mule Deer Part 2
programme.desc: Steve's quest for a giant mule deer buck continues in central Idaho. To help Steve in his journey, Ryan Callaghan has offered up one of his best spots as well as his keen spotting skills. The duo backpack hunt in some of the West's steepest and prettiest mountains seeking the colossal buck of Steve's dreams. In part two Steve finds the buck he's been searching for his whole life. The dream is realized and Steve and Ryan feast on a slow cooked roast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Cooking Special: Butchering a Whole Deer
programme.desc: In this Cooking Special, Steve demonstrates how to butcher a whole whitetail deer.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Duren Deer Camp: Wisconsin Whitetail With Helen and Brittany Part 1
programme.desc: Helen Cho and Brittany Brothers are back for a double episode. This time around they're hunting whitetail deer in Wisconsin on the famed Duren farm with Doug Duren and Steve as their guides. Arriving a few days early to scout and tune up their shooting with some squirrel hunting, the ladies enter the next chapter of their hunting journey.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Duren Deer Camp: Wisconsin Whitetail With Helen and Brittany Part 2
programme.desc: Helen Cho and Brittany Brothers are back for a double episode.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Steve Makes the Team: Kentucky Small Game
programme.desc: Kevin Murphy and his band of Kentucky small game hunters introduce Steve to the finest Kentucky has to offer. Gray squirrels with tree hounds and cottontails with beagles, in Kentucky, it's the dogs that do the hunting. Cathead biscuits, sawmill gravy, and fried small game round out the Kentucky adventure.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: A Trip of Firsts: Mexico Coues Deer
programme.desc: Steve and Janis head into the remote mountains of Sonora, Mexico, to pursue the elusive Coues deer.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to the historic beaver trapping grounds of Wyoming to explore the legacy of the mountain man era. As he sets traps along the Green River, Steve immerses himself in the methods and stories of early American trappers. Alongside his quest to catch beavers, he delves into the fascinating history of how beavers shaped the fur trade and American frontier life. It's a journey through both the rugged landscapes and the rich heritage of the American West.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and ecologist Karl Malcolm head to the Cibola National Forest, guided by a century-old tip from conservationist Aldo Leopold, to hunt Merriam's wild turkeys. Their adventure showcases the forest's rich history and the legacy of Leopold's conservation efforts while they track these elusive birds through challenging terrain.

programme.title: Renovation Hunters
programme.desc: Hal, Kevin, and crew travel to PA to renovate a cabin for the Clear family after they lost their patriarch to ALS.

programme.title: Our Wild Life
programme.desc: Chad and Kelli Varnado love the outdoor life, especially for their son Jack. Together, the family trap shoot in the backyard in preparation for the duck opener, as well as bring home a couple of squirrels harvested from their trees to cook into gravy and fry up for dinner.

programme.title: Dead Meat
programme.desc: Scott Leysath is targeting saltwater and freshwater fish in this action-packed episode of Dead Meat! Joined by a few familiar faces, Leysath is fishing for California Halibut off the coast of Santa Cruz with his pal, Kevin Phillips. From Santa Cruz to Reno, Scott meets up with River Klass, host of the Rach America TV show, for a little range time at Reno Guns & Range. And finally, the two join JD Richey, a 2024 California Outdoor Hall of Fame fishing guide, on Pyramid Lake for some Lahontan Cutthroat Trout action. Oh, and there's machine guns. Lots of machine guns!

programme.title: Feral
programme.desc: If you asked experts what the most prevalent predator species in the United States is, without hesitation, the answer would be the Burmese pythons in the Florida Everglades. Growing up to 26-feet long and weighing as much as 200 pounds, the Burmese python has completely altered the ecosystem of the Everglades by eliminating over 99% of the native mammal population. To save the 'Glades, the hunter has become the hunted as Dusty ""Wildman"" Crum has made it his mission to eradicate this species. Luckily for Yia, python is considered a delicacy in many countries, and Dusty believes these constrictors should be restricted to life on a plate, which helps take a bite out of the problem.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons
programme.desc: Terry and Larry test a famous scene from X-men. They are attempting to see if you can split a bullet with a Katana sword.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "The hunting heritage of South Africa
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "Tajikistan, a Mountainous Land
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "Anti-poaching in Tanzania
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "Human-wildlife conflict in Borneo
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: Home DIsaster Zone
programme.desc: Everyone knows the biggest disasters happen under your own roof. Get ready, it's the Home Disaster Zone!

programme.title: Helene Angley: Queen Size
programme.desc: Helene brings honesty to the stage that helps everyone relax-- and laugh at the joys and pains of aging, being a married mother of two and all that the generation gap brings!

programme.title: Greg Warren
programme.desc: Greg Warren is a nationally touring headliner and has been featured on Late Night with Seth Meyers, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central Presents, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, BET and CMT. Greg is a fan favorite on the nationally syndicated Bob and Tom Radio Show and can be heard daily on Sirius/XM.

programme.title: Kjell Bjorgen
programme.sub-title: I'm Sorry But I Won't Apologize
programme.desc: Kjellbegan his comedy career in Los Angeles, California. He gained some notoriety when featured in both the Chicago comedy festival and Montreal comedy festival. He decided to hone his craft and perform on the road. His hard work paid off when asked to be the opener on the Lewis Black Nothing'sSacredtour. You may have seen him on NBC's LateFridayand Comedy Central's Live at Gotham.

programme.title: Kelly Terranova: A Man Named Kelly
programme.desc: Despite his name, Kelly Terranova isn't a beautiful, witty woman, but what he lacks in luscious flowing locks he makes up for in expressive observational humor.

programme.title: Josh Blue
programme.desc: Following his groundbreaking win on NBC's Last Comic Standing in 2006, Josh Blue has risen through the ranks to become a well-established headliner at venues throughout the world.

programme.title: Patrick Keane
programme.desc: Originally from the Midwest, raised in Orange County, college in Montana and a three-year stint in Asia make Patrick Keane a comedian with a background. Why college in Montana? Football scholarship. Why Asia? To get away from football.Since moving to Los Angeles in 2000, Patrick has appeared on Comedy Centrals Live At Gotham, the Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, the Bob and Tom show, Comics Unleashed, the Montreal Comedy Festival and is a regular at the Improv and Comedy Store in Hollywood. He was also a cast member on My TV Networks Tony Rock Project. (He was the white guy).When not headlining, Patrick is the opening act for comedians such as Nick Swardson, Joel McHale, Kevin Nealon, Kevin Pollok, Bobby Lee, Henry Phillips, Eddie Gossling and Bil Dwyer. While at home in Los Angeles he studies at the UCB theatre and Lesley Kahn institute. Asked what the key is to comedy, this writer/actor/comedian says, I try not to be funny and it usually works. With multiple appearances on the Late Late show with Craig Ferguson, his record setting viewer ship on Comedy Central, and his ability to tell the difference between people from Ireland and people from Northern Ireland, Patrick is the obvious choice to be the next host of the Oprah Winfrey show.His dry, self-deprecating style originates from influences Bill Murray and Gene Wilder. His favorite stand up comedians are Chris Rock, Lewis Black, Gary Shandling, Jerry Seinfeld and many other female comics not from New York.

programme.title: Paul Lyons: You Are Looking at a Winner
programme.desc: Paul Lyons says there's a bright side to everything. Sometimes, it takes looking at life through a dog's perspective, placing guest-proof affirmations throughout the house, or adding your morning nap to your to-do list.

programme.title: Rob Maher: If You Can Make It Here...
programme.desc: Rob Maher proves that he has the most versatile first name in the English language, that your relationship ended because you didn't spend enough money on wrapping paper, and that being an "accident" is worse than being adopted.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Gene Rayburn hosts this comedy-game show hybrid in which contestants try to match answers given by celebrities to humorous, and often risque, fill-in-the-blank questions. The contestant with the most points at the end of the game advances to play the bonus round, in which the contestant has a chance to win thousands of dollars, with the actual amount dependent on the rules in place at the time of the episode.

programme.title: Card Sharks
programme.desc: This show from legendary Mark Goodson-Bill Todman Productions features two contestants trying to predict answers to survey questions for the opportunity to play a game with oversized playing cards for a chance to win cash. One contestant guesses how many people (out of 100) gave a certain answer to a question and the other contestant then guesses if the number is higher or lower than the opponent's guess. The winning contestant then faces a row of cards and must determine if each succeeding card is higher or lower than the one that precedes it. The contestant who wins two out of three games wins the match and plays the bonus round, called Money Cards. The Money Cards round is similar to the card game in the main game but with three levels of cards instead of one row. The contestant is given $200 at the beginning of Money Cards and wagers any or all of that money when guessing if the cards will be higher or lower than the previous one. A perfect round could earn the contestant $28,800.

programme.title: Foxy Brown
programme.desc: Unable to pay back the $20,000 he owes the mob, small-time hustler Link (Antonio Fargas) instead gives up the identity of an undercover cop (Terry Carter) who happens to be dating his sister, Foxy Brown (Pam Grier). When gangsters later kill the cop, Foxy is quick to make the connection and swears vengeance. Posing as a prostitute, and with the help of a group of neighborhood vigilantes, she gradually tracks down the hit men, their Mafia bosses and her own brother.

programme.title: BloodRayne
programme.desc: In 18th-century Romania, after spending much of her life in a traveling circus, human-vampire hybrid Rayne (Kristanna Loken) escapes and plots to take down her evil vampire father, Kagan (Ben Kingsley). When she's discovered by three vampire hunters, Vladimir (Michael Madsen), Katarin (Michelle Rodriguez) and Sebastian (Matt Davis), she manages to convince them to spare her life and join her cause. But slaying a vampire as powerful as Kagan will be no easy task.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: Feisty Morgan Adams (Geena Davis) inherits her late buccaneer father's galleon and one-third of a map to buried treasure located on Cutthroat Island. The map had been tattooed on her father's scalp, and to find the treasure, she must locate and scalp his two brothers. But Morgan's swashbuckling uncle, Dawg Brown (Frank Langella), wants the treasure for himself, and does battle with his headstrong niece and her unwilling accomplice, Latin-speaking physician William Shaw (Matthew Modine).

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Ghiaccio's Stand, White Ice is able to envelop him like a bodysuit and able to freeze everything around him to extremelylow temperatures. Giorno and Mista somewhat make it to Venice, despite being partially frozen by Ghiaccio...

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.sub-title: The Final Mission from the Boss
programme.desc: By revealing to each other a fearless embrace of the unknown, Giorno and Mista emerge victorious against Ghiaccio. Now, a single member of Bruno's group must face a single bell tower, a single elevator shaft, and a single menacing task.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: In the crypt of a Venetian church, Bruno discovers not only the brutal truth behind the Boss's true intentions but also the unstoppable Stand power he wields, a power that leaves Bruno in a pool of blood and in a moral quandary.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Bruno and team, now self-chosen traitors, learn from Trish during a moment of calm at a Venetian caf a trip to Sardegna is vital. Chaos, then, erupts as Narancia loses his tongue and ability to speak the truth after spotting a shark in his soup.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: As Giorno is teleported between puddles with Squalo's shark attached firmly to his jugular, Narancia tries to sniff out the perpetrator using his CO2 tracer but is inhibited by Tiziano's tongue-fusing Stand, frustrating himself and Bruno's team.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Bruno et al head to Marco Polo airport to venture to Sardegna to discover the truth behind Trish's father. On the tarmac, however, is a swollen, neckless Stand user who, the team discovers while airborne, is linked to the freshly severed fingers onboard.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: At cruising altitude, Trish faces a voracious and fleshy mass of a Stand that strikes at the slightest movement. Meanwhile, Giorno's incessantly pulsating broach, the key to the team's survival, lies waitingas does an unseen force within Trish.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.sub-title: A Little Story From the Past ~My Name Is Doppio~
programme.desc: Bruno and team make an emergency landing in Sardegna where the Hitman Team leader, Risotto, is also determined to uncover a certain mystery. Doppio, a timid, wide-eyed teen, the result of a seemingly impossible pregnancy, has his own goals on the island.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Having discovered there is more to skittish Doppio than meets the eye, Risotto uses his Stand to manifest various metallic instruments of torture from within his enemy. Fortunately for Doppio, a way to foresee the inevitable offers a glimmer of hope.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.sub-title: Under a Sky That Could Come Falling at Any Moment
programme.desc: A picturesque Sardinian cliff becomes the bloody backdrop to Doppio's sudden dominance over Risotto, courtesy of Narancia's own Stand. On the beach below, Abbacchio works to rewind time 15 years to identify the identity of a certain photographer.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.sub-title: Get to the Collessium in Rome!
programme.desc: With Abbacchio's replaying ability interminably stamped in stone, Bruno and team analyze the cryptic face and fingerprints left behind when a mysterious call arrives. They must race to the Colosseum, the caller warns, if they hope to ever defeat the Boss.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: No sooner than Bruno and team set foot on the shore near Rome the team finds a flesh-eating mold devouring everyone in sight. It's the work of Cioccolata, made worse by his partner Secco, who records the tortured faces of his victims to be viewed later.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Branching off from Bruno, who opts to tackle the underground swimmer Secco, Giorno and Mista chase Cioccolata as he flies to spread rotten ruin upon Rome. Their battles unfold in front of a mystery ally silently awaiting their arrival at the Colosseum.

Then, in Cambodia we find the mysterious temples of Angkor. And finally, we head over to Vietnam to enjoy the beaches, rivers, and Buddhist pagodas.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As little ones grow, their innate sense of wonder grows too, creating an occasion for celebration with each new discovery. Baby Galileo Discovering the Sky introduces them to that remarkable canopy above us: the sun and moon, fluffy clouds, shimmering stars, colorful planets and whirling galaxies.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Meet fascinating creatures from across the globe and learn to run, hop, and crawl like your favorite animal friends. Dance and sing along to discover animal names and the native habitats of the world's most unique creatures. See real-life images of lions and zebras on the African savannah, then learn animal names through repetition and narration, or simply watch your favorite animals play!

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Every stage is an exciting adventure with your newborn. As babies grow, they absorb a wide variety of sights and sounds. And with so much to see and hear, infants seem to enjoy, and be most soothed by, gentle sounds such as your voice or pleasant, restful music. Treat your child -- and yourself -- to the delights of Baby Bach Musical Adventure, an award-winning program that exposes babies to the joy and majesty of classical music while presenting them with stimulating, colorful images.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn about Dogs, Cats and More
programme.desc: Meet Cats, Dogs, Birds, Bugs and Woodland Creatures! Learn simple words through narration and repetition. Meet all sorts of creatures from domestic kittens to jungle cats, puppies, big and small birds, butterflies, lady bugs, otters and deer!! See whimsical toys and puppets.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn Signs: Family and Home
programme.desc: Discover sign language along with your favorite Baby Einstein Characters! Learn how to sign the names of common things from different objects found at home and outside, family, and even your very own neighborhood through repetition and narration. Real-life images of toys and objects along with gentle melodies engage viewers as they learn a variety of different signs.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn About Animals Around the World
programme.desc: Meet fascinating animals from across the globe! Dance and sing along with puppets and discover some of the world's most unique creatures. Join us to dance along to classical melodies as we learn animal names through narration and repetition or simply enjoy seeing live-action footage.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Cal, Neptune, Opus, Dean, Tinker and others learn about the flora and fauna of the ocean through STEAM-based principles and real-life footage.

programme.title: Cal's Sound Yard
programme.desc: Cal's Sound Yard is a new animated series from Baby Einstein that introduces the letters of the alphabet and the sounds they make. Why all the tracing and repetition? And why are the letters out of order? Don't worry! There's a reason for all that the content is based on "The Einstein Way" - a curiosity-driven learning philosophy, from industry experts, inspired by Montessori and STEAM.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As little ones become better acquainted with the world, they grow curious about animals of all kinds, beyond just the family pet. And as their communication skills continue to develop, they enjoy imitating animal sounds as well. Baby Noah Animal Expedition takes your little explorer across the globe to meet animals -- two-by-two -- from the savannah, the rainforest and tropics, the Outback, the ocean and the Polar Regions.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Dive in with your little explorer across the seas to meet amazing animals living in the ocean, coral reef, and polar regions. Overflowing with underwater footage of whales, dolphins, tropical fish, and more, Neptune's Oceans invites you and your baby on an oceanic voyage of discovery!

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Get moving with Baby Einstein! Real, live-action footage and classical melodies engage young viewers as they discover simple words related to movement. Enjoy encouraging melodies and live-action footage of babies and animals as you learn and move alongside your favorite Baby Einstein friends. Dance along as you watch real, live action footage of animals, children, and toys.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Learn all about music and rhythm in the world around us! Discover classical music and learn instrument names through narration and repetition. Inspire sweet dreams with gentle melodies and a comforting bedtime story. Learn about classical music from Beethoven, Bach, and Mozart. Sing and dance along to classic rhythmic songs like The Wheels on the Bus and see real-life images of instruments.

programme.desc: Are you up for an adventure of a lifetime? Get ready as everyone's favorite purple dinosaur Barney and his dino-pals are simply out to have some fun! The children show off their special talents in an I Can Do show.

programme.desc: Are you up for an adventure of a lifetime? Get ready as everyone's favorite purple dinosaur Barney and his dino-pals are simply out to have some fun! Barney and his friends help a new friend feel welcome when she moves into the neighborhood.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Are you up for an adventure of a lifetime? Get ready as everyone's favorite purple dinosaur Barney and his dino-pals are simply out to have some fun! Barney helps his friends learn about safety with a little help from his friend, Firefighter Bill.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Angel Cake likes everything "just so" - and when things don't go her way, she's a pretty bad sport... until Strawberry & Apple Dumplin' help her become the berry best of sports.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Strawberry's cat Custard is shown to live a pampered, adored existence in Strawberry's house. But Custard's dream set-up is shattered by the sudden arrival of a rambunctious stray puppy, Pupcake, who Strawberry takes in during a storm.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Strawberry Shortcake's friendship letter to children around the world elicits an invitation from Crepes Suzette to visit Pearis and the Pieffel Tower. Some of the other children and Custard are not so sure that it is wise to visit a strange land.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: The girls are driven to distraction by their frisky puppies frolicking all over Berry Bitty City! Full of energy and thinking that everything in town is a toy for them to play with, they cause comical mayhem wherever they go. Strawberry suggests the pups need a place of their own where they can play, a dog park! The girls decide to call in Huckleberry, who runs an animal hotel in Berry Big City, to help design the park.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While sipping cider in Strawberry's caf, the girls muse about how they cannot wait for winter to arrive. They list the various traditions they love about the season but the one they all agree on is the Glimmerberry Ball. Strawberry mentions that she doesn't think the caf can hold the party this year because of how the town has grown. The girls decide to split up and search for a new location.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Lemon is ecstatic. She races out of her salon and goes around to the other girls' houses proclaiming that she "did it!" and beckoning them to join her. They follow her back and are completely dazzled by her newest creation - Glamicures. They are brightly colored, jeweled manicures with tiny microchips inside that play songs when the wearer moves her hand. Each girl lines up to receive her new glamicure and soon there is a cacophony of color and sound.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While working in her store, Orange overhears the Berrykins laughing and shouting outside. When she goes to the door to investigate, a clump of dandelion fluff gets blown inside chased by three Berrykins. She watches as they head butt the clump around until it floats back toward Orange. Just as it floats close, she gives it a bat sending it outside and the Berrykins happily chasing after it. Wanting in on the fun, she joins them.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While enjoying lunch in the caf, the girls are interrupted by some music coming from the gazebo. They head outside and find Sadiebug and Kadiebug wearing badges and standing by a banner and podium. A group of chairs are set up in front of them. The twins begin to announce, and then argue, that they are starting a club - a good citizens club. The girls are shocked as the twins argue with each other all the time.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: With all the Baby Berrykins running around Berry Bitty City, Princess Berrykin decides to build a Day Care Center and playground. But she's worried because it's dull-looking - all grey metal and brown wood. She asks Strawberry whom might be good to help her out. And two names immediately come to her mind - Lemon and Raspberry! The Princess confesses she's always admired their sense of design and style.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Finding she has some free time one morning, Strawberry visits Berrykin Bloom who is filled with excitement over his new crop of Berry Bitty fruits and vegetables his garden has never grown so much produce! He can't wait to share his new crop (the perfect bitty size) with Berry Bitty City, so Strawberry volunteers to help him transport the produce to Orange's General Store.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Strawberry is really touched when her girlfriends and the Berrykins volunteer to help her with the construction of her new marketplace, so when the girls suggest they take charge of designing Strawberry's dream-bedroom to go on the second story, of course Strawberry agrees. While construction is going on, the girls each show Strawberry their individual ideas for the bedroom.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: With time running out before the Grand Opening celebration for the new Marketplace, Strawberry's friends get the idea to invite her favorite singer, superstar CHERRY JAM, to be the guest singer. The girls are blown away when their berryjuice cell phone gets a text message that Cherry accepts their invitation! Strawberry is touched by their surprise, but reminds them that now the town and Marketplace really have to shine!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Cherry Jam is so enjoying staying in Berry Bitty City, that she calls her managers in Big Bitty City and informs them that she is going to stay for a much needed vacation! Strawberry and the girls are thrilled that she will be with them for a little longer, and they do all they can to make their guest comfortable. But Cherry doesn't want to be treated like a guest she wants to fit in and contribute to the community.

She envisions a small, simple productionuntil she hears about a gigantic production of Snowberry and the Seven Berrykins that's a smash hit in Berry Big City. She becomes convinced that unless she does the same play in the same grand scale, she'll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Plum races the play into production.

programme.title: Berryella and Prince Berry Charming
programme.desc: Strawberry and the girls excitedly plan to put on a Story Time On Stage musical play for the Berrykin kids: Berryella and Prince Berry Charming, directed and choreographed by Plum, with musical direction by Cherry. Strawberry will play Berryella, with Lemon and Blueberry as her comically jealous stepsisters, and costume designer Raspberry as her Fairy Fashionmother. Orange is the stage manager, assisted by stagehands Berrykin Ed and Berrykin Earl. They've barely begun when they face their first problem: the Berrykin who was supposed to play Prince Charming has broken his toe and must bow out of the production!

programme.title: Rainbow Ruby

programme.desc: Rev and the gang are painting a mural for Four-Wheeled Friendship Day! But with Avery in charge, the friends start to lose confidence in their work. Ebb and Flo's home is an old boat moored by the beach. Things Couldn't Be Better!

programme.title: THE WAWIES
programme.desc: Wawaland is a tiny world within planet Earth. So small and light that it gets carried away by the wind. Right now, it could be flying over Tokyo, Paris, or the Atlantic Ocean, completely unseen by humans. In this magical place live The Wawieschubby and curious beings who are always asking questions and trying to make sense of the world around them and ours. Through Sha's far-away glasses, the Wawies can observe how humans behave on Earth and apply what they learn in their own world, sparking endless adventures that teach them, entertain them, help them explore their surroundings, and listen to themselves. They always stick together and never leave anyone behind. For example, this season, you might find them competing in their own version of Wawachef, escaping from some not-so-friendly monkeys, deciding to ban rules in their world forever, trying to calm down some feisty ants, training their patience to care for a garden, or figuring out which costume party is more fun: Halloween or Carnival. With each adventure, Sha, Opo, Aca, Bow, and Tok strive to understand, grow, and have fun. And along the way, they'll unintentionally create their own set of rules to live in a place where respect and harmony with their surroundings are key. With its playful and cheerful tone, Wawaland seeks to show children a different way of seeing thingshelping them appreciate the world around them and, most importantly, themselves.

programme.title: Doby & Disy: Exploring Journey
programme.desc: Adorable twin brother and sister, Doby & Disy, go on adventures in the magic forest together with their friends. They learn different colors, figures, songs and communication skills by solving various problems on the way.

programme.title: Hogie the Globehopper
programme.desc: Hogie the Globehopper is a fun tv show that will inspire a curiosity and fascination about the world and its people. Hogie and his friends Lorna, Bernie and Floaty travel the world, making lots of friends along the way.

programme.title: Princess Play Time
programme.desc: The proud Princess likes to do things her own way, but her antics are always joined by her restless brother, Prince, who tends to turn everything topsy-turvy. Any playtime in their room transforms into a fantastic journey through unusual worlds: the children arrange a picnic on the Moon, conduct a detective investigation in a toy city, or search for pirate treasures on islands! Although initially, the Princess and Prince seem to clash and compete, by the end, they always find joy in each other's company and that of their cherished dog, Bona.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Being an only lamb in the flock' Timmy has been used to getting his own way. Now for the first time Timmy is going to have to learn to get along with other little animals. Timmy is going to Nursery! Self-willed and naughty Timmy is going to have to learn how to share things with other youngsters and think about their feelings not just his. Timmy is a gifted little footballer who needs to learn that it's not enough to kick the ball you have to pass it too. Harriet Heron and Osbourne Owl, who run the Nursery are going to have their hands full, but Timmy gets it right in the end with a little help from his friends of the furry, feathery and spikey type.

programme.title: Counting With Paula
programme.desc: The show features Paula and her friends, Tim, Billy, Chalky, Calc, and the Numbers as they go on exciting adventures in colorful and exotic places. From the Amazon jungles to the deepest oceans, and to the hottest deserts, Paula and friends solve problems, have fun and make more friends along the way!

programme.title: Berry and Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, the little snail boy and Dolly, the ladybird are best friends. Together they discover the world around them, while they make new friends with Balthazar the bee, Flutter the butterfly, Stanley the stag-beetle, Leapy the grasshopper, and many others.

programme.title: Stella And Sam
programme.desc: As they explore the world in all its seasons, Stella and Sam have wild adventures and comical mishaps. They make friends and discover many things - especially about themselves. If Sam is bold enough to rescue Fred from the sprinkler, then maybe he really can be brave enough to have a sleepover in the backyard tent. Every day is a new adventure, and Stella and Sam share the joy of discovering that they have what it takes to face the biggest adventure of all... growing up.

programme.title: Play with Cocobi
programme.desc: Color play, dance, and more. Let's have fun with Cocobi!

programme.title: Cocobi Sing-Alongs Toys
programme.desc: Sing along to popular kid's songs with Cocobi toys!

programme.desc: Dive into Chiki Art Soothing's world filled with artworks like Glitter Fish, Shooting Star and more

programme.desc: Get grooving with a medley of fun kids songs like Dinosaur Song, Fruits Song, and Colors Song

programme.title: Non Stop Hits
programme.desc: Get ready for a non-stop collection of kids' songs, like The Road Trip Song, Horsey Horsey and more!

programme.title: Sid the Science Kid
programme.desc: A youngster named Sid, who aspires to a career in stand-up comedy, pitches a morning monologue to his stuffed animals that hinges on a burning question (such as "Why do bananas get brown spots?"), then spends the rest of the day searching for the answer in this hybrid combination of animation and puppetry from The Jim Henson Co., in its first PBS project since "Sesame Street."

programme.title: Superhero Kindergarten
programme.desc: Superhero Kindergarten - Bessie We Hardly Knew Ye: Vik's quest to find Bessie the lake monster teaches everyone that just because you can't see something doesn't mean it isn't real.

programme.title: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures
programme.desc: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures - Cosmic Contest: The Overlords, disturbed from their Space Nap by a battle, force PacWorld, Netherworld, and Pointyhead fighters into a wild race through dangerous locations to decide which planet gets banished.

programme.title: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures
programme.desc: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures - That Smarts!: In the absence of Sir C, Pacopolis needs a new genius, especially after Buttocks hacks Sir C's computer and builds a giant indestructible robot based on Grinder's design.

programme.title: Bakugan Geogan Rising
programme.desc: Bakugan Geogan Rising - The Search for Geogan! / The Geogan Arcleon!: In search of the mysterious Geogan they witnessed the night before, the AB have a run in with Crystal Blue, Everett and Strata. / An AAAnimus Security Force transport vehicle loaded with confiscated Baku-Balls is hijacked.

programme.title: Bakugan Geogan Rising
programme.desc: Bakugan Geogan Rising - Chase the Mysterious Bakugan! / Drago in the Crosshairs!: There are reports all over Los Volmos of a rogue Bakugan rampaging at night and destroying people's property. / A strange golden Bakugan has been appearing at practise fields across Los Volmos in search of Dragonoid of Pyrule.

programme.title: Atomic Betty
programme.desc: Atomic Betty - The Good, The Bad, and Sparky: On Earth, Betty gets salesmanship advice from her father as she tries to sell candy door-to-door. Meanwhile, in space, Sparky becomes a movie star when famous galactic director Antoine Lucci casts him in his latest movie, but when Maximus gets involved, the danger on the set becomes very real!/ Betty's mom buys a new automatic feeding and grooming machine for Purrsy, and she wants Betty to put it together! Betty takes the machine with her to space, where her mission is to test out a new, technologically advanced spaceship, complete with its own new, advanced robot, X-8.5. Will X-5 be replaced by this new, technologically advanced robot?

programme.title: Atomic Betty
programme.desc: Atomic Betty - The Great Race / Poached Egg: Betty has a date after school with Dylan, the new boy in her class, but first she must stop Maximus, who has created a new explosive device known as the Shredder, which upon detonation, with destroy the time/space continuum. Now Betty is in a race to defuse the Shredder, save the galaxy and return to Earth in time for her date! / Chef Bernadette quits as Maximus' personal chef, so Maximus orders Minimus to make him an omelette Piraxian Rhino Egg. Problem is, there is only one such egg left in existence! Betty and her crew must stop Maximus from poaching the last egg. Meanwhile, on Earth, Betty is blamed for starting a food fight in the school cafeteria. Will Noah's video evidence clear her name?

programme.title: Rainbow Rangers
programme.desc: Rainbow Rangers - Whale of a Tale: Heavy boat traffic is disruptive to a migrating whale and her calf and the Rangers need to find a way to keep the whales safe. / The Rangers save a coral reef from being damaged by a reckless construction team.

programme.title: Stampede!
programme.desc: While stranded in the jungle during a massive storm, Claire and Simon unknowingly stumble upon a clue to the whereabouts of the treasure sought by Sinjin.

programme.title: Dreamocracy

programme.title: Interfearence

programme.title: Friends Fright Challenge
programme.desc: Feeling out of her comfort zone and overwhelmed by Olly's obsession with fame, Paisley turns to Zac for help with something completely unrelated: dancing.

programme.title: Snakebit
programme.desc: Lloyd, having been kicked out of the Hynobrai snake tribe unlocks a second tribe The Fangpyres to help him regain control. The Ninja are busy setting up their new HQ that Zane discovered, but are called to duty when the Fangpyres attack the village where Jay's family lives.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Avengers Reassembled
programme.desc: Finally, the Avengers confront Ultron and his Ultron Minions as they attack Avengers' Tower. Ultron's ultimate plan: use all the data/stuff they've stolen to free the newly rebuilt IRON LEGION, destroy the Avengers, and control the world. Tony dons the hastily repaired Hulk Buster Armor and it's on! It's a huge battle as the Avengers try to save their beloved HQ and defeat Ultron. Will they succeed? And, more importantly, can their party be saved after Ultron tries to take down their Tower?The Avengers prepare for a party with a surprise guest when Ultron crashes the preparations by using mind control on Iron Man. While trying to rescue their leader, the rest of the team discovers that Baron Stucker, HYDRA, and Yellowjacket are in on Ultron's plans. While preparing for a party at Avengers' Tower, THE AVENGERS (IRON MAN, CAPTAIN AMERICA, BLACK WIDOW, HAWKEYE, THOR, HULK and VISION) notice Iron Man acting strangely. When Iron Man volunteers to go out and get more ice, they find it odd: when has Tony every volunteered to get anything? Suddenly, ULTRON appears on a screen: he's taken control of Iron Man! To make matters worse, Ultron takes over all the versions of Iron Man's armor and they fly off! The Avengers must now fight one of their own, and they're not sure what to do! Cap and Thor lead the charge, but can't fend off Iron Man and Ultron's Minions. Meanwhile, Black Widow, Hawkeye and Hulk track down a signal that seems to be controlling Iron Man from a castle in the Little Sokovia section of New York. There they fight HYDRA and BARON VON STRUCKER and learn that YELLOWJACKET is the bug that infected Iron Man's suit for Ultron. To help break Iron Man free from Ultron's control, the Avengers call in their own bug...ANT MAN!

programme.title: The Power Of Merlok
programme.desc: When Jestro attacks a village on the far side of the Kingdom, the NEXO-Knights wonder how they'll get there. Then Macy remembers her dad has a royal RVmaybe they can mod that for their own, knightly use? Now the NEXO-Knights get rollingin THE FORTREX, their own ROLLING CASTLE! This great new HQ, which houses Merlok 2.0 as an operating system, will be how the knights move around Knighton and protect it from Jestro and his monsters. Speaking of the evil jester, in this episode Jestro uses some newly-made monsters to attack a town far from the capitol where he thinks he's safe from the Knights' reach. We see two parallel stories here: the Knights training, learning more about digital magic and getting organized as a team and at the same time we see Jestro making monsters, trying to learn how his powers work and talking to the Book. In the end, the Knights roll up in their castle and defeat Jestro and his marauding monsters. Lance thinks he should be the leader because he's a snot. Of course I'm the leaderI'm a Richmond.

programme.title: The Warrior Within
programme.desc: Cragger tricks Laval into withholding CHI from the Crocodile tribe. This reignites the hostilities between the Lions and Crocodiles. Laval must frantically escape the wrath of the Crocs and somehow get rid of the CHI before his father finds out.

programme.title: The Hybrid Horror!

programme.title: Xploration Nature Knows Best
programme.desc: Marine biologist Danni Washington hosts this series that explains how nature has helped to inspire technology that people use on a daily basis. Some of the nature-inspired innovations include airplanes inspired by birds and helicopters that were influenced by dragonflies. The show also introduces viewers to people involved in creating innovations that are based on animals, including biologists who study the behavior of ants, architects designing "living buildings" and roboticists who are making their designs bigger and stronger based on animals.

programme.title: DOYOUNG 'Promise' MV
programme.desc: The lyrics, written by DOYOUNG, capture the feelings he couldn't easily express as his love grew deeper. Even if the confession comes late, it delivers a sincerity and emotional resonance stronger than any other words.The title track Promise is an impressive ballad that begins with a minimal piano melody and gradually builds emotional depth as strings are added in the latter half.

programme.title: EXO 'Crown' MV
programme.desc: 'Crown' is a hard dance song that fuses Atlanta trap drums, heavy metal guitars, and EDM synths to break genre boundaries. Siren effects and powerful vocals heighten the dramatic tension, while the lyrics liken a precious loved one to a crown coveted by many, conveying a desperate resolve to protect them at all costs.

programme.title: EXO 'REVERXE' Trailer
programme.desc: EXO has returned with a new trailer. At the end of the trailer, the title of EXO's 8th full-length album, REVERXE, was finally revealed. Based on EXO's universe storyline the day we truly become one, a new world will open the album name reinterprets the word Reverse in EXO's own style, carrying the meaning a new world opens once again, further heightening anticipation.

programme.title: RIIZE 'Fame' MV
programme.desc: The bold, forward-driving rhythmic structure combined with the raw texture of electric guitar creates a dynamic surge of energy. The lyrics reflect RIIZE's artistic vision, delivering the message that what they truly seek is not fame, but the sharing of emotions and love.RIIZE's second single Fame is the group's first venture into a rage-style hip-hop track, expressing their artistic ideals as emotional pop artists.

programme.title: Wycliffe Gordon
programme.sub-title: Wynton Marsalis: In This House, on This Morning
programme.desc: The final concert of the Mnchner Klaviersommer 1992 was by Wynton Marsalis and his septet. The 31-years-young star trumpeter performed one of his own jazz suites to the sold-out Philharmonie, under the title of In This House, On This Morning'. The concert covers every jazz style, in composition and improvisation, and in both small and grand forms. Marsalis's Septet was made up of Wess Anderson (alto saxophone), Wycliffe Gordon (trombone), Reginald Veal (bass), Herlin Riley (drums), Todd Williams (tenor saxophone), and Eric Reed (piano).

programme.title: Dizzy Gillespie, Tony Coe, Derek Humble & Billy Mitchell
programme.desc: American jazz trumpeter, composer, and bandleader Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) was one of the seminal figures of the bebop movement. He fuses all musical forms rooted in African culture, such as music from Cuba, Latin America and the Caribbean, into his music. On November 4, 1970 he played a concert in Denmark with the Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band, performing Con Alma, Brother K, Now Hear My Meanin', Manteca, Let Me Outta Here, and Things Are Here.

programme.title: Chet Baker
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Jamie Cullum
programme.desc: Watch the performance of Jamie Cullum live at Jazz Vienne, in 2017.

programme.title: Jazzmeia Horn
programme.sub-title: Brooks Bowman/Jazzmeia Horn, East Of The Sun
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horn's 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazz's future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singer's performance was a reminder of jazz's enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horn's concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: Bill Evans, Chuck Israels & Larry Bunker
programme.sub-title: Bill Evans' European Tour: Live in '64, '65 & '70
programme.desc: Bill Evans: Live in '64, '65 & '70 features five separate performances by one of the most revered pianists in music history. This collection covers an 11-year span, highlighting Evans' ever-deepening artistry as he performs with four different all-star rhythm sections, including the stunning duo of bassist Niels-Henning rsted Pedersen and drummer Alan Dawson. This recording includes Evans' renditions of the rarely performed Sareen Jurer, Blue Serge, and Twelve Tone Tune Two. Among the many surprises in this collection is a live performance of My Melancholy Baby with saxophonist Lee Konitz.

programme.title: Dizzy Gillespie
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Paul Desmond, Dave Brubeck & Joe Morello
programme.sub-title: Dave Brubeck and Paul Desmond live in Belgium
programme.desc: Dave Brubeck: Live in '64 boasts a beautifully filmed concert from one of the most beloved quartets in jazz history. Captured at the pinnacle of their power and popularity, Paul Desmond (alto sax), Joe Morello (drums), Eugene Wright (bass) and Dave Brubeck (piano) explore the trails they blazed into the realm of odd time signatures with Forty Days' and two versions of their groundbreaking hit Take Five', as well as forays into world music with a unique exploration of Koto Song'. Their intimate onstage chemistry and impeccable musicianship made the DBQ an award-winning jazz supergroup.

programme.title: Philippe Jordan & Orchestre de l'Opra national de Paris
programme.sub-title: Beethoven - Symphony No. 6 in F major, Op. 68
programme.desc: Swiss conductor Philippe Jordan and the Orchestre de l'Opra national de Paris recorded all of Ludwig van Beethoven's symphonies in 2014-2015. In this program, Jordan conducts Beethoven's Symphony No. 6 in F major, Op. 68, also known as the Pastoral Symphony. Beethoven wrote the work upon completion of his Symphony No. 5. Both symphonies premiered at the same legendary, all-Beethoven concert on December 22, 1808. Symphony No. 6 consists of five movements, of which the last three are played without a break. Each movement carries a title that suggests a scene from life in the countryside. The joyful atmosphere of the first three movements is interrupted by the violent fourth movement Thunder, Storm', as expressed by the piccolos, brass, and timpani. As the storm recedes at the end of the movement, the tranquility returns in the final movement. This performance was recorded at Opra Bastille in Paris, France, in 2015.

programme.title: Christine Nonbo Andersen, Tuva Semmingsen, David Bateson & Steffen Bruun
programme.desc: The Danish National Symphony Orchestra takes us on a spectacular symphonic space journey in an out-of-this-world concert program of film music. Under the direction of Dutch conductor Antony Hermus, the orchestra guides us through the musical universe, performing a selection of music from iconic sci-fi movies, such as Avatar, Gravity, Interstellar, and Star Wars, written by major composers such as John Williams, Hans Zimmer, and James Horner. Featured soloists in this concert are Tuva Semmingsen, Christine Nonbo Andersen, Steffen Bruun, and David Bateson. This performance was recorded at the DR Koncerthuset in Copenhagen, Denmark, in August 2021.

programme.title: Nikolay Lugansky
programme.sub-title: Piano works by Rachmaninoff, Beethoven & Glazunov
programme.desc: Russian pianist Nikolay Lugansky has received world-wide praise for his interpretations of the music of Sergei Rachmaninoff. In this wonderful recital, the great pianist presents works by the Russian Romantic composer as well as Ludwig van Beethoven and Alexander Glazunov. Lugansky opens his concert with Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 14 in C-sharp minor, Op. 27 No. 2, Moonlight', followed by Alexander Glazunov's Piano Sonata No. 2 in E minor, Op. 75. Then Lugansky performs a selection of works by Rachmaninoff: Rachmaninoff's piano transcription of J. S. Bach's Partita No. 3 in E major a selection of tudes-Tableaux (Nos. 1, 2, 4, and 8, Op, 33, and Nos. 5 and 6, Op. 39) Lilac (Op. 21, No. 5) Prelude in C minor, Op. 23 No. 7 and Rachmaninoff's transcription of Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky's Lullaby (Op. 16 No. 1). This performance was recorded at the Tchaikovsky Concert Hall in Moscow, Russia, on June 4, 2021.

programme.title: Martha Argerich
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Les Dissonances
programme.sub-title: Mozart - String Quartet No. 19 in C major, K. 465
programme.desc: Les Dissonances is a collective of artists founded by violinist David Grimal in 2004. The conductorless ensemble consists of musicians from the most prestigious European orchestras, international soloists, and young talents. In this performance, Les Dissonances' string quartet consisting of David Grimal (violin), Hans Peter Hofmann (violin), David Gaillard (viola), and Xavier Phillips (cello) performs Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's String Quartet No. 19 in C major, K. 465, Dissonance' (Op. 10 No. 6). The String Quartet is the last in the set of six quartets that were dedicated to Joseph Haydn. Written between 1782 and 1785, these are also known as the Haydn Quartets (Op. 10). String Quartet No. 19 is remarkable for its slow, dissonant introduction, giving the piece its nickname. This ominous passage suddenly gives way to the bright Allegro in C major. This performance was recorded at Opra Comique in Paris, France, in 2015.

programme.title: Evgeny Kissin, Nikolai Demidenko, Warsaw Philharmonic Orchestra & Antoni Wit
programme.desc: Antoni Wit conducts the Warsaw Philharmonic Orchestra in performances of Chopin's Piano Concertos No. 1, Op. 11 and No. 2, Op. 21. Soloists are Nikolai Demidenko and Evgeny Kissin. After performing the first concerto, Demidenko encores with Chopin's Mazurka Op. 17/4. Kissin closes the concert with Chopin's Etude Op. 10/12 and the Waltz in E minor, Op. post. This concert was part of the celebration of Chopin's 200th anniversary in 2010. Chopin composed the second concerto one year before the Concerto No. 1 and completed both works at the age of 20, before leaving his home country Poland and moving to Paris.

programme.title: The Moody Blues
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of their landmark album, Days of Future Passed, The Moody Blues took to the road to perform the entire LP live. This film, capturing an electric evening at The Sony Centre, Toronto, where the band was joined on stage by a full orchestra for the first time ever, is the definitive performance of this seminal album. This spectacle of a show features stunning visuals and a unique narration performed by Jeremy Irons, transporting the audience and viewer to the psychedelic dream world of their classic record. Including the iconic hits Nights In White Satin and Tuesday Afternoon, this film truly pays homage to five decades of musical mastery. In this impressive yet intimate auditorium, The Moody Blues have never sounded better.
